Flags.Description: The kind of log source you want to filter for. Accepted values are 'container', 'application', 'ingress', 'worker', 'storage' and 'kubernetes'. If you do not pass a log source, all logging configs for the cluster will be returned.

Flags.Name: output
Flags.Description: Prints the command output in the provided format.

Flags.Name: <invalid Value>

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: update
Commands.Description: Update a log forwarding configuration for a cluster.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks logging config update --cluster CLUSTER --id ID --logsource LOGSOURCE --type TYPE [--force-update] [--hostname HOSTNAME] [--output OUTPUT] [--port PORT] [-q] (--ca-cert CERT --syslog-protocol PROTOCOL --verify-mode MODE | --org ORG --skip-validation --space SPACE) (--namespace NAMESPACE | -C CONTAINER -p PATH)

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: id
Flags.Description: Specify the ID of the logging configuration.

Flags.Name: namespace, n
Flags.Description: The namespace you want to apply the log forwarding configuration to. Only use this flag with the 'container' log source or if you do not specify a log source. If you do not specify a namespace, then all namespaces use this configuration.

Flags.Name: logsource
Flags.Description: The source of the logs to forward. Supported values are 'container', 'application', 'ingress', 'worker', 'storage', and 'kubernetes'. This argument supports a comma separated list of log sources. If you do not provide a log source, logs for 'container' and 'ingress' will be forwarded.

Flags.Name: type
Flags.Description: The log forwarding protocol that you want to use. The only supported value is 'syslog'.

Flags.Name: syslog-protocol
Flags.Description: When the logging type is 'syslog', the transport layer protocol. Supported values are 'tls', 'tcp' and the default 'udp'. When forwarding to an rsyslog server with the UDP protocol, logs that are over 1KB are truncated.

Flags.Name: ca-cert
Flags.Description: When the logging type is 'syslog' and the protocol is tls, the Kubernetes secret name that contains the Certificate Authority certificate.

Flags.Name: verify-mode
Flags.Description: When the logging type is 'syslog' and the protocol is tls, the verification mode. Supported values are 'verify-peer' and the default 'verify-none'.

Flags.Name: hostname
Flags.Description: When logging type is 'syslog', the hostname or IP address of the log collector. When logging type is 'ibm' (deprecated), the logging ingest endpoint. If you do not provide the logging ingest endpoint, then the current region's endpoint is used.

Flags.Name: port
Flags.Description: The port of the log collector. If you do not specify a port, the default port for the ingestion endpoint is used for 'ibm' (deprecated) and '514' is used for 'syslog'.

Flags.Name: org
Flags.Description: ::deprecated::The org name to send logs to. This flag is only valid when the logging type is 'ibm'. The org name is required when you specify a space name. If you do not specify a space name, then logs are forwarded at the account level.

Flags.Name: space
Flags.Description: ::deprecated::The space name to send logs to. This flag is only valid when the logging type is 'ibm'. The space name is required when you specify an org name. If you do not specify a space name, then logs are forwarded at the account level.

Flags.Name: skip-validation
Flags.Description: Skips validation of the org and space names when they are specified. This can result in a broken logging config if the values are invalid but will take less time to process.

Flags.Name: app-containers
Flags.Description: Specify the containers that you want to collect logs for. To specify more than one path, use multiple flags, such as '-C container1 -C container2'. This option is required for the 'application' log source. If not provided, logs will be collected from all containers from the application log paths passed in.

Flags.Name: C, app-container
Flags.Description: Specify the containers that you want to collect logs for. To specify more than one path, use multiple flags, such as '-C container1 -C container2'. This option is required for the 'application' log source. If not provided, logs will be collected from all containers from the application log paths passed in.

Flags.Name: app-paths
Flags.Description: Specify the absolute file path to collect logs from inside the container. To specify more than one path, use multiple flags, such as `-p path1 -p path2`. Required parameter when specifying 'application' for the log source. Wildcards such as '/var/log/*.log' are accepted but recursive globs such are '/var/log/**/test.log' are not.

Flags.Name: p, app-path
Flags.Description: Specify the absolute file path to collect logs from inside the container. To specify more than one path, use multiple flags, such as `-p path1 -p path2`. Required parameter when specifying 'application' for the log source. Wildcards such as '/var/log/*.log' are accepted but recursive globs such are '/var/log/**/test.log' are not.

Flags.Name: force-update
Flags.Description: Force an update of the Fluentd pods in the cluster to the latest version.

Flags.Name: output
Flags.Description: Prints the command output in the provided format.

Flags.Name: <invalid Value>
Flags.Description: <invalid Value>

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Description: Filter out logs that are forwarded by your logging configuration.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks logging filter create --cluster CLUSTER [--container CONTAINER] [--force-update] [--lc LOGGING-CONFIG ...] [--level LEVEL] [--namespace NAMESPACE] [--output OUTPUT] [-q] [--type TYPE] (--message MESSAGE | --regex-message MESSAGE)

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: type
Flags.Description: The type of logs that you want to apply the filter to. Currently all, container, and host are supported.

Flags.Name: logging-configs
Flags.Description: A comma separated list of your logging configuration IDs. If not provided, the filter is applied to all of the cluster logging configurations that are passed to the filter. You can view log configurations that match the filter by using the --show-matching-configs flag with the command.

Flags.Name: namespace, n
Flags.Description: The Kubernetes namespace from which you want to filter logs.

Flags.Name: container
Flags.Description: The name of the container from which you want to filter out logs. This flag applies only when you are using log type container.

Flags.Name: level
Flags.Description: Filters out logs that are at the specified level and less. Acceptable values in their canonical order are fatal, error, warn/warning, info, debug, and trace. As an example, if you filtered logs at the info level, debug, and trace are also filtered. **Note**: You can use this flag only when log messages are in JSON format and contain a level field. Example output: {"log": "hello", "level": "info"}

Flags.Name: message
Flags.Description: Filters out any logs that contain a specified message anywhere in the log. The message is matched literally and not as an expression. Example: The messages "Hello", "!", and "Hello, World!", would apply to the log "Hello, World!".

Flags.Name: regex-message
Flags.Description: Filters out any logs that contain a specified message regex pattern in the log. The message is matched as a regular expression. Example: The pattern "hello [0-9]" would apply to "hello 1", "hello 2", "hello 9"

Flags.Name: force-update
Flags.Description: Force an update of the Fluentd pods in the cluster to the latest version.

Flags.Name: output
Flags.Description: Prints the command output in the provided format.

Flags.Name: lc, logging-config
Flags.Description: A logging configuration ID. If not provided, the filter is applied to all of the cluster logging configurations that are passed to the filter. You can view log configurations that match the filter by using the --show-matching-configs flag with the command.

Flags.Name: <invalid Value>
Flags.Description: <invalid Value>

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: cos-bucket
Flags.Description: The name of the Cloud Object Storage bucket that you want to store your logs in. This value is required.

Flags.Name: cos-endpoint
Flags.Description: The Cloud Object Storage endpoint for the bucket that you are storing your logs in. This value is required.

Flags.Name: hmac-key-id
Flags.Description: The unique ID for your HMAC credentials for your Object Storage instance. This value is required.

Flags.Name: hmac-key

Flags.Description: Enable an ALB for the cluster. Must include either '--enable', '--disable', or '--disable-deployment' in the command, but must not include more than one flag.

Flags.Description: Disable an ALB for the cluster. Must include either '--enable', '--disable', or '--disable-deployment' in the command, but must not include more than one flag.

Flags.Name: disable-deployment
Flags.Description: Disable the ALB deployment only. If provided, the ALB deployment is deleted but the IBM-provided Ingress subdomain remains. Must include either '--enable', '--disable', or '--disable-deployment' in the command, but must not include more than one flag.

Flags.Description: Specify a portable public or private IP address that is available on the 'vlan' and in the 'zone' of the ALB to be created or configured.

Commands.Name: classic
Commands.Description: Create a cluster with worker nodes on classic infrastructure.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks cluster create classic --flavor FLAVOR --name NAME --zone ZONE [--disable-disk-encrypt] [--entitlement ENTITLEMENT] [--hardware HARDWARE] [--location LOCATION] [--no-subnet] [--operating-system SYSTEM] [--pod-subnet SUBNET] [--private-service-endpoint] [--private-service-endpoint-allowlist] [--private-vlan VLAN] [--public-service-endpoint] [-q] [--service-subnet SUBNET] [--skip-advance-permissions-check] [--sm-group GROUP] [--sm-instance INSTANCE] [--version VERSION] [--workers COUNT] (--private-only | --public-vlan VLAN)

Flags.Name: name
Flags.Description: Enter a name for the cluster.

Flags.Name: zone
Flags.Description: Specify the zone for the worker pool in a multizone cluster. To list available zones, run 'ibmcloud ks zone ls'.

Flags.Name: private-vlan
Flags.Description: Conditional: Specify the ID of the private VLAN. To see available VLANs, run 'ibmcloud ks vlan ls --zone <zone name>'. If you do not have a private VLAN yet, do not specify this option because one will be automatically created for you. When you specify a private VLAN, you must also specify either the '--public-vlan' flag or the '--private-only' flag.

Flags.Name: public-vlan
Flags.Description: Conditional: Specify the ID of the public VLAN. To see available VLANs, run 'ibmcloud ks vlan ls --zone <zone name>'. If you do not have a public VLAN yet, do not specify this option because one will be automatically created for you.

Flags.Name: private-only
Flags.Description: Use this flag to prevent a public VLAN from being created. Required only when you specify the '--private-vlan' flag without specifying the '--public-vlan' flag.

Flags.Name: operating-system
Flags.Description: Specify the name of the operating system.

Flags.Name: workers
Flags.Description: The number of cluster worker nodes. Defaults to 1.

Flags.Name: hardware
Flags.Description: The level of hardware isolation for your worker node. Use 'dedicated' to have available physical resources dedicated to you only, or 'shared' to allow physical resources to be shared with other IBM customers. For IBM Cloud Public accounts, the default value is shared. For IBM Cloud Dedicated accounts, dedicated is the only available option.

Flags.Name: no-subnet
Flags.Description: Prevent the creation of a portable subnet when creating the cluster. By default, both a public and a private portable subnet are created on the associated VLAN, and this flag prevents that behavior. To add a subnet to the cluster later, run 'ibmcloud ks cluster subnet add'.

Flags.Name: pod-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for pods. The subnet must be at least '/23' or larger. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/pod-subnet'

Flags.Name: service-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for services. The subnet must be at least '/24' or larger. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/cluster-create-vpc' Default value: '172.21.0.0/16'

Flags.Name: disable-disk-encrypt
Flags.Description: Disable encryption on a worker node.

Flags.Name: entitlement
Flags.Description: Set this flag to 'cloud_pak' only if you use this cluster with a Cloud Pak that has an OpenShift entitlement.

Flags.Name: file
Flags.Description: Provide a file containing input parameters in YAML format.

Flags.Name: location
Flags.Description: ::deprecated::Flag maintained for compatibility with an earlier version. Use the '--zone' flag instead.

Flags.Name: public-service-endpoint
Flags.Description: Enable the public service endpoint to make the master publicly accessible.

Flags.Name: private-service-endpoint
Flags.Description: Enable the private service endpoint to make the master privately accessible.

Flags.Name: private-service-endpoint-allowlist
Flags.Description: Enable access control to a cluster master via a private service endpoint allowlist. For more info, see 'http://ibm.biz/se_allowlist'.

Flags.Name: skip-advance-permissions-check
Flags.Description: Skip checking for infrastructure permissions before completing this action. Note that if you do not have the correct infrastructure permissions, this action might only partially succeed.

Flags.Name: gateway-enabled
Flags.Description: Create a cluster with a public gateway to control inbound and outbound network traffic to the cluster. The cluster is created with a 'gateway' worker pool for the gateway and a 'compute' worker pool for your workloads. For more information, see 'https://ibm.biz/gateway_cluster_create'. When set, '--private-service-endpoint' must also be set.

Flags.Name: sm-instance
Flags.Description: The CRN of the IBM Cloud Secrets Manager instance.

Flags.Name: sm-group
Flags.Description: The Secret Group ID of the IBM Cloud Secrets Manager instance where your secrets are persisted.

Flags.Name: machine-type
Flags.Description: The flavor of the worker node. To see available flavors, run 'ibmcloud ks machine-types --zone <zone name>' (for public IBM Cloud accounts) or 'ibmcloud ks machine-types' (for IBM Cloud Dedicated accounts).

Flags.Name: flavor
Flags.Description: The flavor of a worker node. To see available flavors, run 'ibmcloud ks flavor ls --zone <zone name>' (for public IBM Cloud accounts) or 'ibmcloud ks flavor ls' (for IBM Cloud Dedicated accounts).

Flags.Name: version
Flags.Description: Specify the Kubernetes or OpenShift version, including at least the major.minor version. If you do not include this flag, the default version is used. To see available versions, run 'ibmcloud ks versions'.

Flags.Name: kube-version
Flags.Description: Specify the Kubernetes version, including at least the major.minor version. If you do not include this flag, the default version is used. To see available versions, run 'ibmcloud ks versions'.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: pod-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for pods. The subnet must be at least '/23' or larger. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/pod-subnet'

Flags.Description: Specify the Kubernetes or OpenShift version, including at least the major.minor version. If you do not include this flag, the default version is used. To see available versions, run 'ibmcloud ks versions'.

Flags.Name: kube-version
Flags.Description: Specify the Kubernetes version, including at least the major.minor version. If you do not include this flag, the default version is used. To see available versions, run 'ibmcloud ks versions'.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s

Commands.Name: satellite
Commands.Description: Create an IBM Cloud Satellite cluster on your own infrastructure.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks cluster create satellite --location LOCATION --name NAME --version VERSION [--enable-config-admin] [--host-label LABEL ...] [--infrastructure-topology TOPOLOGY] [--operating-system SYSTEM] [--pod-network-interface-selection SELECTION] [--pod-subnet SUBNET] [--pull-secret SECRET] [-q] [--service-subnet SUBNET] [--sm-group GROUP] [--sm-instance INSTANCE] [--workers COUNT] [--zone ZONE]

Flags.Name: host-label, hl
Flags.Description: Labels that describe a Satellite host, formatted as '-hl key=value' pairs. Later, you use these labels to manage capacity and deploy workloads in your Satellite location.

Flags.Name: location
Flags.Description: The name or ID of the Satellite location.

Flags.Name: name
Flags.Description: Enter a name for the cluster.

Flags.Name: version
Flags.Description: The Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud version, including at least the major.minor version. To see available versions, run 'ibmcloud ks versions'.

Flags.Name: enable-config-admin
Flags.Description: Grant cluster admin access to Satellite Config to manage Kubernetes resources.

Flags.Name: zone
Flags.Description: The zone for the default worker pool in a multizone cluster. To list zones for your location, run 'ibmcloud sat location get'.

Flags.Name: operating-system
Flags.Description: Specify the name of the operating system.

Flags.Name: workers
Flags.Description: The number of worker nodes per zone in the default worker pool. Required when '--host-label' is specified.

Flags.Name: pod-network-interface-selection
Flags.Description: The method for selecting the node network interface for the internal pod network. This option can be used only if you also enable Red Hat CoreOS with the '--operating-system' option. To provide a direct URL or IP address, specify `can-reach=<url>` or `can-reach=<ip_address>`. To choose a network interface, specify 'interface=<network_interface>'.

Flags.Name: service-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for services. The subnet must be at least '/24' or larger. For more info, see 'http://ibm.biz/cluster-create-satellite'. Default value: '172.21.0.0/16'

Flags.Name: pod-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for pods. The subnet must be at least '/23' or larger. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/cluster-create-satellite'. Default value: '172.30.0.0/16

Flags.Name: infrastructure-topology
Flags.Description: Specify whether the cluster should run a single worker node or the default number of worker nodes. To create a single-node cluster, specify 'single-replica'. To create a default cluster with multiple worker nodes, specify 'highly-available'. The 'highly-available' option is applied by default.

Flags.Name: pull-secret
Flags.Description: Specify an existing OpenShift entitlement for this cluster's worker nodes by providing your Red Hat account pull secret.

Flags.Name: sm-instance
Flags.Description: The CRN of the IBM Cloud Secrets Manager instance.

Flags.Name: sm-group
Flags.Description: The Secret Group ID of the IBM Cloud Secrets Manager instance where your secrets are persisted.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: config
Commands.Description: Download the Kubernetes configuration files and certificates to connect to your cluster by using kubectl commands.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks cluster config --cluster CLUSTER [--admin] [--endpoint ENDPOINT] [--network] [--output OUTPUT] [-q] [--skip-rbac]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: admin
Flags.Description: Retrieve administrator certificates and PEM keys.

Flags.Name: network
Flags.Description: Retrieve the Calico network config with the Admin config.

Flags.Name: skip-rbac
Flags.Description: Skip adding RBAC roles. Include this option only if you manage your own Kubernetes RBAC roles. If you use IAM service access roles to manage all your RBAC users, do not include this option.

Flags.Name: endpoint
Flags.Description: The server URL to use for the cluster context. If you do not include this flag, the default cluster service endpoint is used. For more info, see 'http://ibm.biz/context-kube' for Kubernetes or 'http://ibm.biz/context-ocp' for OpenShift clusters.

Flags.Name: output
Flags.Description: Prints the command output in the provided format and skips kubeconfig merges.

Flags.Name: yaml
Flags.Description: Format output in YAML.

Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: rm
Commands.Description: Delete a cluster. All worker nodes, apps, and containers are permanently deleted. This action cannot be undone.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks cluster rm --cluster CLUSTER [-f] [--force-delete-storage] [-q] [--skip-advance-permissions-check]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: f
Flags.Description: Force the command to run without user prompts. The cluster's persistent storage is not be deleted unless the 'force-delete-storage' flag is also provided.

Flags.Name: force-delete-storage
Flags.Description: Force the removal of the cluster's persistent storage without prompts regarding storage deletion. Deleted data cannot be recovered.

Flags.Name: skip-advance-permissions-check
Flags.Description: Skip checking for infrastructure permissions before completing this action. Note that if you do not have the correct infrastructure permissions, this action might only partially succeed.

Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: bind
Commands.Description: Add an IBM Cloud service to a cluster by binding the service instance to a Kubernetes namespace.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks cluster service bind --cluster CLUSTER --namespace NAMESPACE --service SERVICE [-q] (--key KEY | --role ROLE)

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: namespace, n
Flags.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace.

Flags.Name: key
Flags.Description: Specify the name or GUID of an existing service key. If you define a service key, you cannot set the '--role' option at the same time.

Flags.Name: role
Flags.Description: Specify the IAM role for the service key. This flag does not work if you specify an existing key to use or for services that are not IAM-enabled, such as Cloud Foundry services.

Flags.Name: service
Flags.Description: Specify the name of the service instance. To see a list of available service instances, run 'ibmcloud service list' for Cloud Foundry services, or 'ibmcloud resource service-instances' for IAM-enabled services.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks ingress secret create --cluster CLUSTER --name NAME [--cert-crn CRN] [--field FIELD] [--namespace NAMESPACE] [--persist] [-q] [--type TYPE]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: name
Flags.Description: A name for the Ingress secret that is created in the cluster.

Flags.Name: namespace, n
Flags.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace.

Flags.Name: cert-crn
Flags.Description: The certificate CRN.

Flags.Name: field
Flags.Description: The secret CRN to include as a field. To pull in the secret without specifying the name, use '--field <crn>'. To specify the field name, use '--field name=<crn>'. To use the IBM Cloud Secrets Manager secret as the prefix, use '--field prefix=<crn>'.

Flags.Name: type
Flags.Description: The Ingress secret type. Can be TLS or Opaque. If no option is specified, TLS is applied by default.

Flags.Name: persist
Flags.Description: Persist the secret in the cluster so that it cannot be deleted.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Description: A name for the Ingress secret that is created in the cluster.

Flags.Name: namespace, n

Flags.Name: cert-crn
Flags.Description: The certificate CRN.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: classic
Commands.Description: Create and enable an Ingress ALB in a classic cluster.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks ingress alb create classic --cluster CLUSTER --type TYPE --vlan VLAN --zone ZONE [--ip IP] [-q] [--version VERSION]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: zone
Flags.Description: Specify the zone for the worker pool in a multizone cluster. To list available zones, run 'ibmcloud ks zone ls'.

Flags.Name: <invalid Value>
Flags.Description: <invalid Value>

Flags.Name: vlan
Flags.Description: The VLAN ID. This VLAN must match the ALB 'type' and must be in the same 'zone' as the ALB that you want to create.

Flags.Name: ip
Flags.Description: Specify a portable public or private IP address that is available on the 'vlan' and in the 'zone' of the ALB to be created or enabled.

Flags.Name: version
Flags.Description: Specify the ALB image version. To see supported image versions, run 'ibmcloud ks alb versions'.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Description: Start a migration of your IBM Cloud Ingress configmap and resources to use with ALBs that run the Kubernetes Ingress image. This command does not change the image type of your ALBs. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/ingress-migrate'
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks ingress alb migrate start --cluster CLUSTER [-f] [-q] [--type TYPE]

Flags.Name: cluster, c

Commands.Name: clean
Commands.Description: Clean up any resources and ConfigMaps that you no longer need, such as after an Ingress migration.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks ingress alb migrate clean --cluster CLUSTER [-f] [--generated-resources] [--iks-ingresses] [--kube-ingresses] [--output OUTPUT] [-q] [--reset-kube-controller-configmap] [--test-ingresses]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: generated-resources
Flags.Description: Delete all resources that were automatically generated during an Ingress migration, including the Ingress resources and ConfigMaps listed in the Migrated to sections in the output of ibmcloud ks ingress alb migrate status.

Flags.Name: test-ingresses
Flags.Description: Delete automatically generated and manually created Ingress resources of class test for the test ALB service running the Kubernetes Ingress image.

Flags.Name: kube-ingresses
Flags.Description: Delete automatically generated and manually created Ingress resources of class public-iks-k8s-nginx or private-iks-k8s-nginx for public or private ALBs that run the Kubernetes Ingress image.

Flags.Name: iks-ingresses
Flags.Description: Delete Ingress resources of class iks-nginx, class nginx, or of no class for public or private ALBs that run the IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service Ingress image.

Flags.Name: reset-kube-controller-configmap
Flags.Description: Reset the ibm-k8s-controller-config ConfigMap to the default settings. The ConfigMap is deleted and re-deployed.

Flags.Name: f
Flags.Description: Force the command to run without user prompts.

Flags.Description: Prints the command output in the provided format.

Flags.Description: <invalid Value>

Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: configure
Commands.Description: Configure a health check monitor for an existing NLB host name in a cluster. To enable the monitor, include the '--enable' flag. To update an existing monitor, include only the flags for the settings that you want to change.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks nlb-dns monitor configure --cluster CLUSTER --nlb-host HOST [--allows-insecure] [--description DESCRIPTION] [--enable] [--expected-body BODY] [--expected-codes CODES] [--follows-redirects] [--header HEADER ...] [--interval INTERVAL] [--method METHOD] [--output OUTPUT] [--path PATH] [--port PORT] [-q] [--retries RETRIES] [--timeout TIMEOUT] [--type TYPE]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: nlb-host
Flags.Description: The host name. To see existing host names, run 'ibmcloud ks nlb-dns ls'.

Flags.Name: type
Flags.Description: The protocol to use for the health check.

Flags.Name: enable
Flags.Description: Enable the health check monitor for the host name.

Flags.Name: description
Flags.Description: Description of the health monitor.

Flags.Name: method
Flags.Description: The method to use for the health check. Default for HTTP and HTTPS: 'GET'. Default for TCP: 'connection_established'

Flags.Name: path
Flags.Description: The endpoint path to health check against. This flag is valid only for type 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'. Default: '/'

Flags.Name: timeout
Flags.Description: The timeout, in seconds, before the IP is considered unhealthy. Must be in the range [1, 15]. Default: '5'

Flags.Name: retries
Flags.Description: When a timeout occurs, the number of retries to attempt before the IP is considered unhealthy. Retries are attempted immediately. Must be in the range [0, 5]. Default: '2'

Flags.Name: interval
Flags.Description: The interval, in seconds, between each health check. Short intervals might improve failover time but increase load on the IPs. The value must be greater than (retries_value + 1) * timeout_value, and must be in the range [10, 3600]. Default: '60'

Flags.Name: port
Flags.Description: The port number to connect to for the health check. When type is TCP, this flag is required. When type is HTTP or HTTPS, use this flag only for ports other than 80 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS. HTTP default: '80'. HTTPS default: '443'.

Flags.Name: expected-body
Flags.Description: A case-insensitive sub-string that the health check looks for in the response body. If this string is not found, the IP is considered unhealthy. This flag is valid only for type 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'.

Flags.Name: expected-codes
Flags.Description: HTTP codes that the health check looks for in the response. If the HTTP code is not found, the IP is considered unhealthy. This flag is valid only for type 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'. Default: '2xx'

Flags.Name: header
Flags.Description: HTTP request headers to send in the health check, such as a Host header. The User-Agent header cannot be overridden. This flag is valid only for type 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'. To add more than one header to the requests, specify this flag multiple times. This flag accepts values in the following format: '--header Header-Name=value'. When updating a monitor, the existing headers are replaced by the ones you specify. To delete all existing headers specify the flag with an empty value '--header ""'.

Flags.Name: follows-redirects
Flags.Description: Set to 'true' to follow any redirects that are returned by the IP. This flag is valid only for type 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'.

Flags.Name: allows-insecure
Flags.Description: Set to 'true' to not validate the certificate. This flag is valid only for type 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS'.

Flags.Name: output
Flags.Description: Prints the command output in the provided format.

Flags.Name: <invalid Value>
Flags.Description: <invalid Value>

Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Commands.Name: set
Commands.Description: Set Kubernetes taints for all worker nodes in a worker pool. Taints prevent pods without matching tolerations from running on the worker nodes.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud ks worker-pool taint set --cluster CLUSTER --taint TAINT [--taint TAINT ...] --worker-pool POOL [-f] [-q]

Flags.Name: cluster, c
Flags.Description: Specify the cluster name or ID.

Flags.Name: worker-pool, p
Flags.Description: Specify a worker pool.

Flags.Name: taint
Flags.Description: Sets taints on all the workers in the worker pool. Specify the Kubernetes taint in the format 'key=value:effect'. The 'key=value' is a pair such as 'env=prod' that you use to manage the worker node taint and matching pod tolerations. The 'effect' is a Kubernetes taint effect such as 'NoSchedule' that describes how the taint works.

Commands.Name: create
Commands.Description: Create a Satellite location to manage OpenShift clusters that you create in your on-premises infrastructure.
Commands.Usage: ibmcloud sat location create --managed-from REGION --name NAME [--cos-bucket BUCKET] [--description DESCRIPTION] [--ha-zone ZONE ...] [--logging-account-id ID] [--pod-network-interface-selection SELECTION] [--provider PROVIDER] [--provider-credential CREDENTIAL] [--provider-region REGION] [-q]

Flags.Name: pod-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for pods. This option can be used only if you also enable Red Hat CoreOS with the '--coreos-enabled' flag. The subnet must be at least '/23' or larger. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/sat-location-create'. Default value: '172.16.0.0/16

Flags.Name: service-subnet
Flags.Description: Specify a custom subnet CIDR to provide private IP addresses for services. This option can be used only if you also enable Red Hat CoreOS with the '--coreos-enabled' flag. The subnet must be at least '/24' or larger. For more info, see 'https://ibm.biz/sat-location-create' Default value: '172.20.0.0/16'

Flags.Name: name
Flags.Description: The name for the Satellite location.

Flags.Name: managed-from
Flags.Description: The IBM Cloud region to manage your Satellite location from. Choose a region close to your on-prem data center for better performance. To list available multizone regions, run 'ibmcloud ks locations'.

Flags.Name: ha-zone
Flags.Description: The name of the zone to create the Satellite location control plane in, such as 'zone-1'. For high availability, you might want to use one of the three zones from the location control plane, and then add the two other zones later.

Flags.Name: cos-bucket
Flags.Description: The IBM Cloud Object Storage bucket name.

Flags.Name: description
Flags.Description: A description for the Satellite location.

Flags.Name: logging-account-id
Flags.Description: The IBM Cloud account ID with the instance of IBM Log Analysis with LogDNA that you want to forward your Satellite logs to. This option is available only in select environments.

Flags.Name: provider
Flags.Description: The name of the infrastructure provider to create the Satellite location in.

Flags.Name: provider-region
Flags.Description: The name of the region in the infrastructure provider where you plan to create all the hosts for the Satellite location.

Flags.Name: provider-credential
Flags.Description: The path to a JSON file on your local machine that has the credentials of the infrastructure provider for the Satellite location. The credential format is provider-specific. For more information, see ‘http://ibm.biz/sat-infra-creds’.

Flags.Name: coreos-enabled
Flags.Description: Enable CoreOS features for the Satellite location.

Flags.Name: logging-key
Flags.Description: The logging instance key.

Flags.Name: activity-tracker-key
Flags.Description: The Activity Tracker instance key.

Flags.Name: pod-network-interface-selection
Flags.Description: The method for selecting the node network interface for the internal pod network. This option can be used only if you also enable Red Hat CoreOS with the '--operating-system' option. To provide a direct URL or IP address, specify `can-reach=<url>` or `can-reach=<ip_address>`. To choose a network interface, specify 'interface=<network_interface>'.

Flags.Name: q
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.

Flags.Name: s
Flags.Description: Do not show the message of the day or update reminders.
